sectiondiv.p: supports RHEL compute nodes, specifically RHEL 7.2. HPE does not ship a RedHat iso with so you will need to provide a copy of the standard RHEL 7.2 iso (RHEL-7.2-20151030.0-Server-x86_64-dvd1.iso) that can be downloaded from the RedHat website.
There are a number of different scenarios for deploying RHEL compute nodes in :

ul.li: Use the lifecycle manager to automatically deploy RHEL to a node when you first install your cloud.
Provision a RHEL node yourself, either manually or using a 3rd party tool, and then provide the relevant information to the lifecycle manager before you install your cloud.
Add a RHEL node to an existing cloud using the lifecycle manager.
Add a RHEL node to an existing cloud by provisioning it yourself, either manually or using a 3rd party tool, and then providing the relevant information to the lifecycle manager.

sectiondiv.p: These four scenarios will be covered in the following sections.

section.title: Using the lifecycle manager to automatically deploy a RHEL compute node
section.p:
The installation process for RHEL nodes is almost identical to that of HPE Linux nodes as described in the topic for Installation for Helion Entry-scale KVM Cloud". The key differences are:
The standard RHEL 7.2 iso must be placed in the stack home directory on the deployer node befoe you begin the insatllation procedure. The file must be named rhel7.iso.
You must identify the node(s) on which you want to install RHEL, by adding the key/value pair distro-id: rhel72-x86_64 to server details in servers.yml. You will also need to update net_interfaces.yml, server_roles.yml, disk_compute.yml and control_plane.yml. For more information on configuration of the Input Model for RHEL, see RHEL Compute Model.
